alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marion County through 515 PM CDT... At 436 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Russellville to 8 miles southeast of Red Bay to near Verona. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Haleyville, Hackleburg, Brinn, Weston, Bear Creek, Tessner, Shottsville, Pearces Mill, Rankin Fite Airport, Upper Bear Creek Reservoir, Byrd, Bexar, Pigeye, Marion County Public Lake and Pikeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
